docs.snippet: Closely fought games marked the thirteenth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. Of the nine scheduled matches five were drawn, including those of the leaders, Erich...
docs.lead_paragraph: Closely fought games marked the thirteenth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. Of the nine scheduled matches five were drawn, including those of the leaders, Erich Eliskases of Austria and Antonio Medina of Spain.

headline.main: DENKER DEFEATED IN NAJDORF GAME; Eliskases, Castillo Draw as Medina Also Shares Point in Argentine Chess

docs.snippet: A new and perhaps more reassuring chapter in the checkered story of dollar bond investments in Latin America may be beginning to unfold, financial observers say, with the proposal of the Republic of Chile to restore service on external debt on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A new and perhaps more reassuring chapter in the checkered story of dollar bond investments in Latin America may be beginning to unfold, financial observers say, with the proposal of the Republic of Chile to restore service on external debt on the basis of straight interest payments acceptable to bondholders' representatives.

headline.main: CHILE'S DEBT OFFER HELD A GOOD OMEN; Her Action Narrows Group of Latin Nations at Odds With Creditors Over Interest

docs.snippet: The net profits of Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., for the twelve months ended Dec. 31 were $9,145,060 after Federal income taxes, Albert V. Moore, president of the company, announced yesterday in his annual report to the stockholders. Net profits for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The net profits of Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., for the twelve months ended Dec. 31 were $9,145,060 after Federal income taxes, Albert V. Moore, president of the company, announced yesterday in his annual report to the stockholders. Net profits for the preceding year were $3,771,285.
docs.abstract: Moore-McCormack Lines comment on plan, annual rept

headline.main: MOORE-M'CORMACK EARNED $9,145,060; Heavy Volume of Business Last Year Offset Increased Costs -- 1946 Profit $3,771,285

docs.snippet: In addition to a $16,000,000 credit to Chile, a series of loans to Latin-American countries probably will be granted by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development within the next few months, it was learned yesterday. According to...
docs.lead_paragraph: In addition to a $16,000,000 credit to Chile, a series of loans to Latin-American countries probably will be granted by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development within the next few months, it was learned yesterday. According to reliable sources, a group of top officials of the bank, headed by John J. McCloy, president, will make a "flying tour" of the Latin countries starting early next month.

headline.main: MORE LOANS SEEN FOR LATIN AMERICA; Group of World Bank Officials to Make Flying Tour There and Visit Bogota

docs.snippet: The influence of the Easter holidays was apparent in the foreign exchange market from the opening to the close of last week. Only a modest business was reported, with a consequent steady array of currency values.
docs.lead_paragraph: The influence of the Easter holidays was apparent in the foreign exchange market from the opening to the close of last week. Only a modest business was reported, with a consequent steady array of currency values.

docs.snippet: Erich Eliskases of Austria, though held to a draw by Carlos Guimard of Argentina, yesterday retained first place in the international chess master's tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Erich Eliskases of Austria, though held to a draw by Carlos Guimard of Argentina, yesterday retained first place in the international chess master's tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ELISKASES HELD TO DRAW; But He Keeps Chess Lead in Argentine Tournament

docs.snippet: Resuming play after a day's rest, Erich Eliskases of Austria drew his fifteenth-round game with Hector Rossetto, champion of Argentina, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Resuming play after a day's rest, Erich Eliskases of Austria drew his fifteenth-round game with Hector Rossetto, champion of Argentina, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: MEDINA TRIUMPHS IN CHESS TOURNEY; He Gains on Eliskases, Held to Draw by Rossetto, in 15th Round of Play

docs.snippet: A high average of moves marked the play in the stubbornly contested games of the sixteenth and semi-final round of the international chess masters' tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ELISKASES HELD EVEN BY MEDINA IN CHESS
Patience of Marshall Marks Bogota Farley

docs.snippet: GENEVA, April 7 -- The United States received two important setbacks in today's sessions of the United Nations freedom of information conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, April 7 -- The United States received two important setbacks in today's sessions of the United Nations freedom of information conference.
docs.abstract: US rebuffed as conf backs Govt support of news agencies and approves Polish plea to send all motions on press responsibility and warmongering to drafting com; some western nations oppose US on latter move; Benton scores USSR notion of freedom, s, Anglo-Amer Press Club, Paris

headline.main: U.S. GETS SETBACKS ON PRESS FREEDOM; Resolution on Warmongering is Sent to Drafting Committee by Geneva Conference
